ETYMOLOGY: From French litre, from Medieval Latin litra, from Ancient Greek lítrā (λίτρα) 'a pound' (a unit of weight, which evolved to volume).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: n. (noun): A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A metric unit of volume or capacity, equal to 1,000 cubic centimeters (approximately 1.76 imperial pints or 1.057 US quarts).
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种公制容量单位，等于1000立方厘米（约1.76英制品脱或1.057美制夸脱）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The car's engine has a two-liter capacity.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这辆汽车的发动机排量是两升。

REGISTER: Standard English (primarily American English spelling; 'litre' is the British English spelling).
